titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Dick Wichman was a graduate of the University of California, Santa Barbara, attended San Francisco Theological Seminary, and received a master's from Berkeley's Baptist Divinity School. Wichman was pastor of a rural church in Lakeside, California, and served on the staff of the Chinese branch of the YMCA in San Francisco. Established in 1874, the Donaldina Cameron House serves the Asian community in San Francisco, California. Dick Wichman worked as Executive Director from 1947-1977. He was later revealed to have sexually abused at least 18 children while they were residents.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of Dick Wichman. Materials include: memorabilia, correspondence (including Christmas letters), publicity and a newspaper clipping, and newsletters (Current) related to Cameron House and Wichman's involvement. The correspondence is addressed to Mr. and Mrs. Roy Garten of Oklahoma.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
